segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and I can’t believe how much is already on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the drain must be clogged, but she hasn’t even noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and it’s going to spread all over the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the cabinets are getting ruined right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are going to slip if they step in that water, but they’re too busy stealing cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless everyone is being in this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is probably soaked by now, but she doesn’t even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is like watching a train wreck—I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to flood if she doesn’t turn off the faucet soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how ridiculous this all is.
segments.speaker: PAR
